page.title: 09SAVAY FARM (contd.)
page.content: The present owners of the farm are Mr. and Mrs. I.F.I. Cakebread. They bought the farm in 1945. Mr. and Mrs. Cakebread used to keep farm animals i.e. chickens, pigs, cattle and horses. But as houses were built near the farm, the residents objected to the smells of the farm and the Cakebreads had to stop stocking animals. Now all the 40 acre farmland is used for growing wheat in three of the four fields. Hay is grown in the remaining field. 2.5 acres of the farm land is woodland. The river Colne runs through the farm and the bridge which was built in 1762, has a stone which marks the boundary between Middlesex and Buckinghamshire. The farmhouse has two ghosts and both appear to be nuns. The farm has appeared in several films made by the B.B.C.
